New Records: John Collins is averaging 18.1 points, 7.8 rebounds, and 2.7 assists per game on a 61.3 true shooting percentage.
Collins has posted averages of 21 points, 8.3 rebounds, and 3.3 assists per game on 59 percent shooting from the field and 44.4 percent from downtown in November.
Collins has a new career-high in assists per game with 2.7 assists per game this season.
Key Match Events: Collins has scored 28 or more points and grabbed at least nine rebounds in each of his last two games, all while shooting at least 50 percent from the field.
In Thursday's win over the Dallas Mavericks, Kyle Filipowski was often tasked with switching on the perimeter to guard Luka Dončić.
Pre-Game Insights: The Jazz have dealt with their fair share of adversity early in the season, with injuries to players such as Taylor Hendricks, Lauri Markkanen, and Jordan Clarkson forcing head coach Will Hardy to tinker with different rotations and lineup combinations.
The development of young players and the resurgence of some veterans has stood out in the opening 11 games of the season, especially with the Jazz going 3-2 over the last five games.
Post-Match Reflections: Will Hardy said, 'Kyle’s understanding is continuing to grow, and this experience is really good for him.'
Hardy also said, 'We’re using handoffs a lot after actions right now. There are times where it really helps our screening.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Jazz are ranked third in the league with 44.5 points per game coming off the bench.
The new-look Association Edition (white mountain) jerseys will be worn starting next season (2025-26).
Others: Collins has generated his own offense and set up his teammates more this season, with a role shift that has increased his creation for others.
The Jazz are no strangers to big men that are capable passers, with Kelly Olynyk serving as a secondary hub last season.
